urls.description: The Plant Charter aims to reduce onsite emissions to air that are harmful to human health and the planet from the plant and equipment we all use.

tweets.text:
The #BradwellB project is currently in Stage 4 of the GDA for the UK HPR1000 reactor. 

This stage includes the @EnvAgency consultation. We encourage you to view their consultation documents and provide feedback on their website

https://t.co/LSvF3gmmHj https://t.co/ySOnTDYOpk

@theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @alex_green84 @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke It happens regularly, but according to @AnglianWater  spokes lady today it is a 1 in 100 year event, yet it happened last year in February with the storms, and happens most times we have downpours.

Here it is Sir James Bevan's letter to the Public Accounts Committee explaining how he mislead them over sewage being dumped into chalk streams.

It does happen "Exceptionally". ü§¨

urls.title: Collection | River & Rowing Museum
urls.description: Donate to the Museum The River & Rowing Museum holds over 20,000 items covering the international sport of rowing, the history of Henley on Thames, the story of the River Thames, the children‚Äôs book The Wind in the Willows and the Modern British artist John Piper. This includes objects, books, ephemera, archival material, artworks and‚Ä¶ Read More

tweets.text: View of the River Thames from the Museum. Don't worry, the #Museum is safe and dry. @EnvAgencySE are recommending we ALL stay safe and dry and don't take your daily exercise along the river bank today.  Enjoy the #Museumfromhome today with a cuppa! https://t.co/9KlprJ0TBB https://t.co/BvlFYDsEfh

#NSIPs21 is coming up! Hear from @BurgesSalmon @TQ_Solutions @EnvAgency @BDBpitmans @PINSgov @countercontext @mhclg & @NaturalEngland 

Hear about ways to successfully obtain a DCO.

Find out more: https://t.co/k02SnE85fL https://t.co/E0rsfp8JSX

https://t.co/WQYeYXZVs7 Some very timely criticism from the Public Accounts Committee (PAC) about the inaction of @DefraGovUK on water quality. The job of PAC is not made easier when the CEO of the @EnvAgency misleads them @JamesBevanEA

tweets.text:
Don't drive through flood water!  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it
@SurreyCouncil https://t.co/akYyRv35XV

There's still time to sign up for tomorrow‚Äôs free online event - please see the @CLANorth tweet highlighted below - our very own Jackie Hamer, Senior Environment Officer will be one of the presenters https://t.co/KWPih09YKk

tweets.text: Today is #WorldWetlandsDay so here is a short thread featuring three of the wetlands that we have built in the last 3 years. The wetlands were built with the support of partners @EnvAgencyNW  @natural_course @theriverstrust @unitedutilities @wyrecouncil, landowners and developers https://t.co/AAVj6MEnnR

@jamesowild Please put huge pressure on @AnglianWater to sort pumping station in @BurnhamDeepdale (BUDWSP). Broken again & spewing sewage onto main road, which runs into storm drains, then out into harbour. Have reported to @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency, no follow up yet. https://t.co/rM8IBEZuEi

tweets.text: @AnglianWater @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke Hi @AnglianWater, this runs into a harbour that as well as being a SSSI, SPA etc also has a shellfish industry and the fishermen will be less than happy if they have to suspend sales because you‚Äôve contaminated their shellfish with sewerage. I‚Äôve reported this issue before.

@AnglianWater @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @StaitheSmoke But this isn‚Äôt new and I‚Äôve dealt with you with the same issue at the pumping stations at both Harbour Way and Beach Road all dumping sewerage into the harbour. Thankfully those two are since resolved but not after a long standing issue. It needs sorting.

@AnglianWater @mchapmanallen @BurnhamDeepdale @nationaltrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @AndrewDJamieson @WestNorfolkBC @anglianwater sewage system flooding 2 houses on the farm & car park of shops, polluting a SSSI @nationaltrust harbour, many houses now can't flush toilets or use showers etc, and your reply is that you'll be there as soon as you can. This has been flooding for more than 2 weeks!

@AnglianWater @alex_green84 @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke That's all well and good, surely as you was "monitoring" something should be put in place to stop this pollution.
Sounds like it isn't the 1st time this has happened either

@theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @alex_green84 @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke @AnglianWater monitoring isn't good enough. Your pumping station in @BurnhamDeepdale is overflowing, pouring sewage infected water into storm drains that flow into SSSI harbour. Do not understand silence from @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @jamesowild @BrancasterNT Video this am. https://t.co/SSoErYipKs

@EnvAgencyAnglia @EarthlyIdeas @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke So you‚Äôre allowing sewerage to run into the harbour that has a shellfish industry and the lays are up the same end as this pumping station? Really?

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Surely someone in the committee has seen the overwhelming amount of data on the eye watering number of discharges every year to reach the conclusion that exceptional circumstances has nothing to do with it?

@UTSurfaceMike His reply does 2 things.

1. Highlights that the @EnvAgency known perfectly well about the Court of Justice ruling and the words "Exceptional circumstances".

2. That he's still prepare to mislead the committee or has no idea of what's actually going on out there.

Neither is cle

@AnglianWater @mchapmanallen @BurnhamDeepdale @nationaltrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @AndrewDJamieson @WestNorfolkBC @AnglianWater spokes lady claims that this is 1 in 100 year issue, yet this same thing happened last year when we had series of storms in February, happens whenever there's heavy rain storm. In last few years this has happened on numerous occasions, so investment now is vital.

@Feargal_Sharkey Exceptional circumstances hey? Think this guy needs a guided tour of what is really happening on a day to day basis, then he can recalibrate his understanding of the word exceptional...

tweets.text: @AnglianWater @mchapmanallen @BurnhamDeepdale @nationaltrust @EnvAgencyAnglia @AndrewDJamieson @WestNorfolkBC @AnglianWater You really feel you are doing all you can?  My 70 year old mother is having to get up at 4am each morning to switch on pump in her cellar, as it continues to flood.  Drains locally are backing up, meaning the already high water table is constantly being topped up.

@ThePhilipCarter @The_ONR @EnvAgency @BradwellBan We will design a drainage system & demonstrate through Flood Risk Assessment that there will be no impacts to 3rd parties from BRB build & operation. This is discussed & agreed w/ @EnvAgency through the EIA process. Safety is a priority we‚Äôd never compromise at BRB or Bradwell A.

tweets.text: Proud to see the PM praise the work of @EnvAgency staff in #PMQs today. Our thoughts are with those who have flooded over the past few weeks. Thanks again to all of #teamEA who work around the clock to protect communities from flooding https://t.co/SSEvytl8Sa https://t.co/ZdNtG0lu06

Dr Stewart Davies, Ines Faden da Silva and Lilli Matson have been appointed to the Environment Agency Board. 

Environment Secretary George Eustice welcomes the members and says, ‚ÄúTheir knowledge and experience will be an asset to the Environment Agency‚Äù https://t.co/khA0iBvxer

@CGNBradwellB @The_ONR @EnvAgency And what effects would that 7m platform have on the rest of the area, inc. Bradwell A and it's existing stores of Nuclear Waste? How have the plans ensured that water wouldn't just end up flooding Mersea or Maldon or anywhere else along the estuary? @BradwellBan #leavebradwellbe

Still lots of High Volume Pumps in use to manage levels in the #Hull catchments of the @EnvAgencyYNE patch tonight. We continue to mobilise & refuel pumps. Our assets work hard and occasionally pay the price with breakdowns & so when this happens we work to bring in replacement. https://t.co/8E3lPKOu3L

tweets.text: This morning I joined #teamEA‚Äôs Mental Health Network on #TimeToTalk day. Talking about #mentalhealth saves lives and improves our wellbeing. 1 in 4 people each year will experience mental ill health. Let's end the stigma. It‚Äôs OK not to be OK. https://t.co/dqxwGoZ1t3

The levels on the River Thames are still high. This photo shows the areas most affected. There are now 20 flood warnings and 38 flood alerts across our #Thames area. Please stay safe at home if you can. Check your flood risk at https://t.co/64gyL62UXF. https://t.co/A3m1iflgrp
